bullets.text: U.S. PPI final demand +0.3% in September; goods +0.9%, services flat, indicating goods-side price pressure while services cool.
Core wholesale prices rose less than expected while retail sales gained, easing inflation fears but consumer demand resilient.
Regulators finalized modifications to regulatory capital standards and proposed measures to help community banks while maintaining strong capital, signaling ongoing recalibration of postcrisis rules.
Medicare unveiled negotiated prices for 15 drugs, pressuring pharma margins and promising lower out-of-pocket costs for seniors.
Meta reportedly adopting Google AI chips sent Nvidia shares lower; Nvidia claims its GPUs remain a generation ahead, underscoring intensifying AI hardware rivalry.
Dell missed revenue but guided higher on surging AI server demand, highlighting durable enterprise AI capex despite macro uncertainty.
U.S. home sellers are delisting at the fastest pace in nearly a decade, constricting supply and supporting prices despite rate-cut hopes.
Australia’s inflation quickened to 3.8% in October, above forecasts, complicating Reserve Bank easing prospects and supporting the Aussie dollar.
Musk’s xAI is reportedly closing a $15 billion round in December, escalating the capital race among frontier AI developers.
Families of Oct. 7 victims sued Binance, alleging the exchange facilitated Hamas financing, amplifying legal and regulatory pressure on crypto platforms.
Russia intensified strikes and resisted an amended Ukraine peace plan as U.S. political divisions muddle negotiations, sustaining geopolitical risk.
Scientists identified a hidden vulnerability implicated in Alzheimer’s, offering a potential new therapeutic target for slowing neurodegeneration.
New brain maps reveal circuits for sensing internal bodily states (interoception), informing research on anxiety, depression, and autonomic disorders.
AI-guided satellite geophysics led to discovery of a massive lithium deposit, underscoring technology’s growing role in critical minerals exploration.
HP will cut up to 6,000 jobs and issued weak guidance amid U.S. trade restrictions, reflecting tech-sector demand softness and policy headwinds.
